::: {.course-overview}
# Course Overview

This short course provides a basic introduction to Git and GitHub.

We are using Git/GitHub throughout QSPL and assume you are familiar with at least its basics. This course will provide you with the required knowledge to get started with Git/GitHub.

:::


::: {.course-goals}
# Course Goals

* Understand what Git and GitHub are and what they are good for.
* Be able to perform basic Git/GitHub operations. 
* Be familiar with sources that you can use to learn more.

:::

::: {.course-prerequisites}
# Course Prerequisites

No specific prior knowledge is required. We assume you have basic computing skills.

:::


::: {.course-content}
# Course Content

The course consists of these modules and units.


## Module 1

- [Introduction to Git/GitHub](github-introduction/github-introduction.qmd)
- [Installation and Setup](github-install-setup/github-install-setup.qmd)
- [Basic Use](github-use/github-use.qmd)
- [Git/GitHub and confidentiality](github-confidentiality/github-confidentiality.qmd)
- [Additional Topics](github-further-topics/github-further-topics.qmd)
- [Further Resources](github-resources/github-resources.qmd)


:::
